snippet: Five employees of the Greenwood 2 trucking company are accused of stealing more than $5 million via a complex cover-up to avoid paying drivers union wages and contributing to union benefit funds.
abstract: Five employees of the Greenwood 2 trucking company in Brooklyn are accused of stealing more than $5 million in union benefit money from Local 282, the truck drivers' union, through a complicated embezzlement scheme; all five, including company owner John Farnsworth, face charges including embezzlement and fraud.
lead_paragraph: Five employees of the Greenwood 2 trucking company are accused of stealing more than $5 million via a complex cover-up to avoid paying drivers union wages and contributing to union benefit funds.

headline.seo: Workers at Greenwood 2, Trucking Company, Are Accused of Defrauding Union
headline.main: Trucking Company Workers Are Indicted in Fraud Scheme
headline.print_headline: Trucking Company Workers Are Indicted in Fraud Scheme
